content: In J.R.R. Tolkien's Middle-earth legendarium, what is the name of the fictional volcano where the One Ring was destroyed?

In J.R.R. Tolkien's Middle-earth legendarium, the name of the fictional volcano where the One Ring was destroyed is Mount Doom, also known as Orodruin in Sindarin. This location holds great significance in the story, particularly in "The Lord of the Rings" trilogy, as it is the only place where the One Ring can be unmade. The mountain is located in the heart of Mordor, the stronghold of the Dark Lord Sauron. It is here, in the fires of Mount Doom, that Frodo Baggins, with the help of Samwise Gamgee, attempts to fulfill his quest to destroy the ring and bring an end to Sauron's power.
